definition: to attend a class/to go to a lecture
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: Here is the best system for note-taking and studying I've discovered so far.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一种最佳的听课记笔记学习系统，据我所知。

sentences.english: Actually, one other word about the readings and the lectures.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，也就是说关于阅读材料和听课。

sentences.english: Seaman began taking classes anywhere she could find them and is now even part of a polymer clay guild.
sentences.chinese: 希曼开始四处听课，还成了一个软陶班的指导员。

sentences.english: Sitting cross-legged on the floor for a lecture was a painful business.
sentences.chinese: 盘脚坐在地板上听课是件很不舒服的事情。

sentences.english: We could not concentrate on the lesson because the room was noisy.
sentences.chinese: 屋里太吵，我们无法全神贯注地听课。

sentences.english: Anybody without attendance card is not allowed to attend the course at any excuse.
sentences.chinese: 无听课证者不得以任何理由进入教室听课。

sentences.english: Anybody without attendance card is not allowed to attend the course at any excuse.
sentences.chinese: 无听课证者不得以任何理由进入教室听课。

sentences.english: Okay? It's nice to see you back
sentences.chinese: 好吗？很高兴见到你们来听课

sentences.english: They're both parts of the class.
sentences.chinese: 因为阅读与听课都是本课程的组成部分。

sentences.english: so the first two quarters we took group lectures.
sentences.chinese: 前两个季度我们集体听课。

sentences.english: More carefully you listen in the class, less time you spend in review after class.
sentences.chinese: 你听课越仔细，课后花在复习上的时间就越少。

sentences.english: She was all ears in class.
A visit to classroom and a valuation on class in an important activity for teachers to raise their teaching level.
sentences.chinese: 听课与评课是提高教师教学水平的一项重要活动。

sentences.english: After listening to Davy, he asked the great man for a job.
sentences.chinese: 听课之余，法拉第请求伟人给他一份工作。

sentences.english: The class, we need to seriously undermine the classroom lectures and not to discipline.
sentences.chinese: 课堂上我们需要认真听课和不要破坏课堂纪律。

definition: to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to attend a lecture/to listen to a talk
(coll.) to sit in on a class
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
